title: Muggle Potions
body:
by viajera_pensativa

After the war, many magical people are struggling with sadness over those they’ve lost. Some coping strategies do more harm than good. (Unfinished, not currently being worked on)

Words: 5099, Chapters: 3/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Harry Potter - J. K. Rowling
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Harry Potter, Ginny Weasley, Minerva McGonagall, Poppy Pomfrey
  • Relationships: Harry Potter/Ginny Weasley
  • Additional Tags: Drug Use, Drug Addiction, Oral Sex, Drug Withdrawal

Read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2KkLOC7

blog.name: soviet-medved
blog.title: dimka's wizarding sketchbook
blog.description:
greetings comrades ,it is I Dimka, a Russian witch studying in Hogwarts and a proud slytherin.  
this blog is dedicated mostly to my ocs,  hp ocs and my hpmc shenanigans. from time to time I post unrelated are too 
hope you enjoy your stay, make sure to give the niffler a snack before you walk out

question: 3, 11 and 19 ❤💞💕💓💖
answer:
thanks for the asks!

ill starts rom the end

19; mcgonagall is definetly one of his favorite teachers, he apreciates how stern and serious she is in lesson and how unlike snape shes not scared to show students that she cares about them. He has a talen at making her laugh, every lesson is main goal is to tell atleast one good joke that will atleast make her smile . he also would always stop her in coridors to have a nice chat,she was like a good teacher friend to him.

11: when he looks at the mirror of erisea he sees his mom and dad standing behind him and holding hands. abit after Efrosiniya was born their mom broke up with their dad because he became a thief and couldnt help but steal any shiny thing he sees, now hes on the run from the ministry, no one found him yet thankfully. yasha really liked his dad,despite being a criminal he had a big heart and loved him and his mother alot , his dad was the one who told him about the vaults and he tried to find them just to make him proud. (also not related to the question but everyone in his family call him yasha, jacob is yakov in russian and short for yakov is yasha)

3 : relaxing in hogwarts express, yasha always finds long rides as an aportunity to catch up on some sleep

blog.name: unforgivablecurse-breaker
blog.title: The Struggling Slytherin Kid
blog.description: Jack Fawley. Otherwise known as Jacob's Sibling™

summary: Harry and Snape did not have a “Rivalry” or a “Mutual animosity.”
title: Harry and Snape did not have a “Rivalry” or a “Mutual animosity.”
body:
And referring to their relationship as such, places undeserved guilt on Harry’s shoulders. 

((Anti-Snape post ahead, you have been warned.))

Characters like Dumbledore are always disappointed that Harry has his “differences with Professor Snape.” that Harry is unable to set aside. Even Remus insists that Harry has “inherited an old prejudice.” Which would imply that it’s Harry’s responsibility to try and see another side of Snape. Even though Snape has never shown another side to him. People act like it was a rivalry, similar to Harry and Draco. Like there were faults on both sides. But that simply isn’t true. Harry’s hatred of Snape developed over time, as a result of how he was treated. Snape’s hatred of Harry was completely unwarranted. A result of his complicated feelings toward the son of his true love and worst enemy.


Don’t get me wrong, I realize that meeting Harry can’t have been easy.

For all we know, it might have been extremely uncomfortable for Snape to meet the child of Lily and James. I understand the position he was in. But even so,  that’s not Harry’s fault. Snape is the adult in this situation, he can sort through that emotional baggage on his own time. Harry and James are not the same person, even if they look alike, and there’s no excuse for projecting unresolved anger onto a child. Harry and Snape’s “animosity” only began because Snape couldn’t bring himself to treat Harry with the faintest semblance of decency. Like I said, I know Snape had plenty of reason to feel awkward around Harry. But he could have done better than treating Harry like trash. Yet he doesn’t even try. Right from the start, he bullies and emotionally abuses an eleven year old that he doesn’t even know.


 And nobody does anything about it, either.

Snape’s behavior would, in any other situation, be disciplined. But here, Harry is the one asked to be the bigger person. He’s just expected to grit his teeth. Which, by the way, he does. In most of their conversations, Harry responds to Snape’s open insults by at least pretending to show respect. Usually because Snape could punish him if he doesn’t. Which is another reason this “rivalry” was uneven - Snape held a position of power over Harry. Power that he would happily abuse - insulting Harry, and then giving him detention for not taking the insults lying down. Snape was left unregulated to treat his students however he pleased, and he treated them like dirt. It wasn’t just Harry, either. If a teacher in real life treated students the way Neville and Hermione were treated in Snape’s class, I am fairly certain that teacher would be fired.

Now, I’ve seen people express the same sentiments as Dumbledore. That Snape’s behavior toward Harry is regrettable, but that Harry is equally responsible for how things turned out, being biased against Snape and always hating him. That his refusing to trust Snape was his own mistake. That Snape was always fighting to protect him and help Dumbledore, and Harry was bratty toward him. Even if we want to say Harry’s at fault for not keeping an open mind about Snape (despite not having any reason to) I do have to ask - Harry always hated Snape? Really? 


Because Harry was remarkably tolerant of Snape’s behavior, for quite a while.

Probably used to such treatment thanks to the Dursleys, Harry really doesn’t express any venom toward Snape in the first two books. Apart from suspecting him of being after the Philosopher’s Stone (which was because of Snape’s injured leg, not personal bias)  Harry merely calls Snape his least favorite teacher, and laments that Snape hates him so much. Harry is nothing but respectful in the face of all the bullying. So, when does he crack? In the third book, when it gets personal. Snape is viciously insulting Harry’s father, not for the first time, and only then does Harry finally tell him to back off. Tells him “Shut up!” Which, sure, isn’t something a student should say to a teacher. Out of context, it is kinda bratty. But the thing is, we have context. This teacher has spent the last three years mistreating him. This teacher was insulting an orphan’s dead parents. Harry had every right to get angry.

The second time in POA that Harry blows up at Snape, comes in the Shrieking Shack. 

Between stealing Harry’s cloak, insulting Hermione without provocation (again) and attempting to drag Sirius and Remus to the dementors, Harry loses his patience. And really, who can blame him? He’s begun to realize that Sirius might actually be innocent, and Remus…literally hasn’t done anything at all. Snape is way too eager to subject them to the Dementor’s Kiss. I know, I know they have history. I know that Sirius nearly killed Snape before. But that isn’t an excuse to look the other way when there’s potential evidence of Sirius’ innocence. And it’s definitely not an excuse to let the Dementors perform the kiss on Remus. ((This was based on what, exactly? Suspicion? Snape had no proof that Remus had been helping Sirius - because he hadn’t been.))

Yet still, even as the Trio attempts to stop him from essentially murdering two people, Snape refuses to listen. Shouts insults at Hermione when she (very politely) suggests they listen to what Sirius has to say. (Later on, he attempts to discredit the trio’s testimony, just to make sure he gets what he wants.) So Harry calls him pathetic, and attempts to disarm him. 


And, honestly? Snape is pathetic. 

He might be clever. He might be talented. He might be brave. The bravest man Harry ever knew. I’m not going to argue that he was brave. I’m not going to deny his talents - he was the greatest Occlumens and Potions Master of the entire series. But he was still pathetic. An adult who bullies a child to take petty revenge on his own childhood bully (who is long dead) can be described no other way. Outing a Werewolf and potentially ruining his life, all because of bitterness, is the definition of pathetic. After POA, Harry finally seems to actively hate Snape. But after three years of emotional abuse at the hands of his own teacher, over something that literally had nothing to do with him (James) Don’t you think he earned that?

Whenever people give Harry grief for being so suspicious of Snape in HBP, or try to hold Harry accountable for the failure of the Occlumency lessons, or for snooping in Snape’s Memories…it frustrates me. Snape has his talents, but teaching is simply not one of them. Harry has no reason to respect or trust Snape at all. Dumbledore insists that Snape is on their side, but won’t tell Harry why. ((Dumbledore is arguably worse than Snape, particularly since he enabled all this…but that’s a post for another day.) Snape never makes any attempt to perceive Harry as anything but James 2.0, and never fails to punish him for James’ actions. Please, tell me why Harry should keep an open mind about him, or give him the time of day. Tell me why there are faults on both sides. Harry was a child when they met, and he never did anything to Snape. On the other hand, Snape took it upon himself to decide that Harry and James were “the same” and then went out of his way to make Harry, and all of Harry’s friends, miserable. And nobody reprimanded him for it.

He died a hero, trying to honor Lily and defeat Voldemort. And I hope he rests in peace. But if he really did love Lily, he could have treated her son a little better.
body_abstract:
And referring to their relationship as such, places undeserved guilt on Harry’s shoulders. 

((Anti-Snape post ahead, you have been warned.))

trail.content:
And referring to their relationship as such, places undeserved guilt on Harry’s shoulders. 

((Anti-Snape post ahead, you have been warned.))

Characters like Dumbledore are always disappointed that Harry has his “differences with Professor Snape.” that Harry is unable to set aside. Even Remus insists that Harry has “inherited an old prejudice.” Which would imply that it’s Harry’s responsibility to try and see another side of Snape. Even though Snape has never shown another side to him. People act like it was a rivalry, similar to Harry and Draco. Like there were faults on both sides. But that simply isn’t true. Harry’s hatred of Snape developed over time, as a result of how he was treated. Snape’s hatred of Harry was completely unwarranted. A result of his complicated feelings toward the son of his true love and worst enemy.


Don’t get me wrong, I realize that meeting Harry can’t have been easy.

For all we know, it might have been extremely uncomfortable for Snape to meet the child of Lily and James. I understand the position he was in. But even so,  that’s not Harry’s fault. Snape is the adult in this situation, he can sort through that emotional baggage on his own time. Harry and James are not the same person, even if they look alike, and there’s no excuse for projecting unresolved anger onto a child. Harry and Snape’s “animosity” only began because Snape couldn’t bring himself to treat Harry with the faintest semblance of decency. Like I said, I know Snape had plenty of reason to feel awkward around Harry. But he could have done better than treating Harry like trash. Yet he doesn’t even try. Right from the start, he bullies and emotionally abuses an eleven year old that he doesn’t even know.


 And nobody does anything about it, either.

Snape’s behavior would, in any other situation, be disciplined. But here, Harry is the one asked to be the bigger person. He’s just expected to grit his teeth. Which, by the way, he does. In most of their conversations, Harry responds to Snape’s open insults by at least pretending to show respect. Usually because Snape could punish him if he doesn’t. Which is another reason this “rivalry” was uneven - Snape held a position of power over Harry. Power that he would happily abuse - insulting Harry, and then giving him detention for not taking the insults lying down. Snape was left unregulated to treat his students however he pleased, and he treated them like dirt. It wasn’t just Harry, either. If a teacher in real life treated students the way Neville and Hermione were treated in Snape’s class, I am fairly certain that teacher would be fired.

Now, I’ve seen people express the same sentiments as Dumbledore. That Snape’s behavior toward Harry is regrettable, but that Harry is equally responsible for how things turned out, being biased against Snape and always hating him. That his refusing to trust Snape was his own mistake. That Snape was always fighting to protect him and help Dumbledore, and Harry was bratty toward him. Even if we want to say Harry’s at fault for not keeping an open mind about Snape (despite not having any reason to) I do have to ask - Harry always hated Snape? Really? 


Because Harry was remarkably tolerant of Snape’s behavior, for quite a while.

Probably used to such treatment thanks to the Dursleys, Harry really doesn’t express any venom toward Snape in the first two books. Apart from suspecting him of being after the Philosopher’s Stone (which was because of Snape’s injured leg, not personal bias)  Harry merely calls Snape his least favorite teacher, and laments that Snape hates him so much. Harry is nothing but respectful in the face of all the bullying. So, when does he crack? In the third book, when it gets personal. Snape is viciously insulting Harry’s father, not for the first time, and only then does Harry finally tell him to back off. Tells him “Shut up!” Which, sure, isn’t something a student should say to a teacher. Out of context, it is kinda bratty. But the thing is, we have context. This teacher has spent the last three years mistreating him. This teacher was insulting an orphan’s dead parents. Harry had every right to get angry.

The second time in POA that Harry blows up at Snape, comes in the Shrieking Shack. 

Between stealing Harry’s cloak, insulting Hermione without provocation (again) and attempting to drag Sirius and Remus to the dementors, Harry loses his patience. And really, who can blame him? He’s begun to realize that Sirius might actually be innocent, and Remus…literally hasn’t done anything at all. Snape is way too eager to subject them to the Dementor’s Kiss. I know, I know they have history. I know that Sirius nearly killed Snape before. But that isn’t an excuse to look the other way when there’s potential evidence of Sirius’ innocence. And it’s definitely not an excuse to let the Dementors perform the kiss on Remus. ((This was based on what, exactly? Suspicion? Snape had no proof that Remus had been helping Sirius - because he hadn’t been.))

Yet still, even as the Trio attempts to stop him from essentially murdering two people, Snape refuses to listen. Shouts insults at Hermione when she (very politely) suggests they listen to what Sirius has to say. (Later on, he attempts to discredit the trio’s testimony, just to make sure he gets what he wants.) So Harry calls him pathetic, and attempts to disarm him. 


And, honestly? Snape is pathetic. 

He might be clever. He might be talented. He might be brave. The bravest man Harry ever knew. I’m not going to argue that he was brave. I’m not going to deny his talents - he was the greatest Occlumens and Potions Master of the entire series. But he was still pathetic. An adult who bullies a child to take petty revenge on his own childhood bully (who is long dead) can be described no other way. Outing a Werewolf and potentially ruining his life, all because of bitterness, is the definition of pathetic. After POA, Harry finally seems to actively hate Snape. But after three years of emotional abuse at the hands of his own teacher, over something that literally had nothing to do with him (James) Don’t you think he earned that?

Whenever people give Harry grief for being so suspicious of Snape in HBP, or try to hold Harry accountable for the failure of the Occlumency lessons, or for snooping in Snape’s Memories…it frustrates me. Snape has his talents, but teaching is simply not one of them. Harry has no reason to respect or trust Snape at all. Dumbledore insists that Snape is on their side, but won’t tell Harry why. ((Dumbledore is arguably worse than Snape, particularly since he enabled all this…but that’s a post for another day.) Snape never makes any attempt to perceive Harry as anything but James 2.0, and never fails to punish him for James’ actions. Please, tell me why Harry should keep an open mind about him, or give him the time of day. Tell me why there are faults on both sides. Harry was a child when they met, and he never did anything to Snape. On the other hand, Snape took it upon himself to decide that Harry and James were “the same” and then went out of his way to make Harry, and all of Harry’s friends, miserable. And nobody reprimanded him for it.

He died a hero, trying to honor Lily and defeat Voldemort. And I hope he rests in peace. But if he really did love Lily, he could have treated her son a little better.
trail.content_abstract:
And referring to their relationship as such, places undeserved guilt on Harry’s shoulders. 

((Anti-Snape post ahead, you have been warned.))

blog.name: emmioneimage
blog.title: Emma Watson: A Criticism of Her Public Persona
blog.description:
Hello, you may call me Sam. Welcome
to my criticism blog of celebrity/public personality Emma Watson. This blog is
not a criticism of her private life, just a place where people may share their
opinions of the public actions and words of Watson.  Note that any hateful, derogatory, or
threatening comments towards Emma Watson, visitors, and me will not be
published and may be reported to Staff. Please enjoy your visit.

summary: She needs to get it out of her head that if she did LLL, she would have been nominated or won that Oscar. There are tons of good...
question: She needs to get it out of her head that if she did LLL, she would have been nominated or won that Oscar. There are tons of good films but because of shitty actors, it was still panned by critics and there are also tons of bad films but well acted. LLL was perhaps the best script that was ever given to her but she went out of her way to make it hell for the staff and crew so she was let go for a better actress with lesser demands. I reckon she had a taste of humble pie at that point.
answer: I don’t think it humbled her. If anything, it made her even more entitled. It became her agent’s fault for losing the role. She switched agencies. And then she implied she would have won, while never congratulating Stone, and when people called her out on it, she acted like she doesn’t care about getting an Oscar ha.

reblog.comment: I don’t think it humbled her. If anything, it made her even more entitled. It became her agent’s fault for losing the role. She switched agencies. And then she implied she would have won, while never congratulating Stone, and when people called her out on it, she acted like she doesn’t care about getting an Oscar ha.

And then she implied she would have won, while never congratulating Stone, and when people called her out on it, she acted like she doesn’t care about getting an Oscar ha.

And then she implied she would have won, while never congratulating Stone, and when people called her out on it, she acted like she doesn’t care about getting an Oscar ha.

blog.name: sirfluffig
blog.title: Flavius (Flavio) Filion Frederick Ceccere
blog.description: Avatar by @thecursedzerin | 16 | he/him | Ravenclaw| ENTP/ENFP| Bisexual Disaster

body:
Who is Eldorian ?

The letter reached Flavio in a time of distress and fear and led the young Ravenclaw to the conclusion that his crazy uncle Eldorian Handoris may have a clue where Jacob is right now.

During the summer holidays, he decides to talk to his parents about his uncle and ask them about his residence.

“Sir, Ma'am…am i allowed to ask you question?” Flavio slowly approaches his parents. His shaking fingers running through his dark brown hair and his eyes filled with the same  fear as if a boggart would try to scare him. He reaches for his hidden wand just to feel safe.

His parents both wearing their proud Gryffindor crest on the coat looking at him disapproving.

“You are a Ravenclaw Student, you should be smart enough to answer the question yourself” throws his father at him with an annoyed tone.

His mother raises an eyebrow and smiles “What do you want Flavius”…

The boy cleared his throat. “Flavio” he mumbles. His fear filled eyes searching for cover  “anyways Mr. Ceccere and Mrs. Ceccere, I wanted to ask what happend to Eldorian Hand- “

He was cut off by the voice of his raging mother “NEVER MENTION THIS NAME EVER AGAIN!!!” His father adds “Eldorian Handoris is not only a blood traitor but also a criminal and the most dangerous Slytherin after Voldemort. He is suspected to be a Death Eater spy in the ministerium. If you know something about his position, tell me….i have some unfinished business with him”

Flavio bows to his parents “thank you for your time lord and lady Ceccere , I’ll go into my chamber, if you need me,tell me….good night”

As he lies down and tries to sleep, his thoughts about Jacob keeps him awake. After some time he finally manages to fall asleep.

In his dream he sees himself, battle wounded and bloodied in front of him. As he looks down, he sees dark bloody robes. He feels a weird patch at his eye.

As he finally sees his reflection in one little puddle in the ground he looks in the face of a scattered boy, his brown hair falling into his face and covering the eye-patch. His bloody red eye starring in his own Soul. Flavio realizes that he is in the body of Jacob…

Scared of what happens next Flavio raises bis wand and casts Depulso at his threat, bashing him at the wall. This leaves him enough time to flee.

Suddenly he wakes up, his fears and thoughts don’t let him get some rest. He wants to understand Jacob but it’s to hard to get behind his motives. Flavio packs his stuff and leaves the mansion,if his parents don’t like Eldorian its  probably because he does the right thing and tries to help without demanding any reward. He decides to search Eldorian..This man is the only one that can help to find Jacob…..

blog.description:
FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!

tags: hermione let him have his moment
summary: Harry when he found out Draco was a death eater
body:
Harry when he found out Draco was a death eater

Harry: I told you so. I SAID MALFOY WAS A DEATH EATER FOR A WHOLE YEAR AND YOU DIDNT BELIVE ME

Hermione: Yes Harry I get it you’re right I was wrong but you still didn’t have to stalk him for a whole year

Ron:…

Harry: HERMIONE LET ME HAVE MY MOMENT AND I DID ABSOLUT NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES STALK HIM

Draco: *is standing a meter away from them and has heard the whole conversation*

Draco: You were stalking me?

Golden trio: SHUT UP MALFOY

trail.content_raw:
by Baryshnikov

blog.description: Redbubble Instagram Buy Me A Coffee Hello there weary travelers! Welcome to my Art Blog! I had to remake it as tumblr marked my old one as explicit! Feel free to ask about commissions! 🌻🌻🌻

summary: This is the start of me posting some drawings i’ve done throughout the start of 2019. I couldn’t post these before because...
caption:
This is the start of me posting some drawings i’ve done throughout the start of 2019. I couldn’t post these before because they’re part of a sketchbook which I’ve done for my friend @siriuspiggyback and I didn’t want to run the risk of her seeing anything from her present as it was surprise! 

First up is Remus and Sirius for @siriuspiggyback

(1/40 sketchbook pages (Kate’s sketchbook))

I just write HP stuff that pops up in my mind.


Yes my header is a flamingo

tags: dumbledore is the captian of this ship
summary:
Dumbledore: That Malfoy kid wants to kill me?
Snape: yes but 
Dumbledore: Harry needs to see me die 
Dumbledore: Malfoy can...
body:
Dumbledore: That Malfoy kid wants to kill me?

Snape: yes but

Dumbledore: Harry needs to see me die

Dumbledore: Malfoy can comfort him and then drarry will happen

Snape: Drarry?

Dumbledore: Thats so smart

Dumbledore: 10 points to Dumbledore

Snape: Why do I even work here?

blog.name: wolfstarisbeststar
blog.title: -: Marauders :-
blog.description: Female she/her : Demi Bi : I'm antisocial as all hell but don't be afraid to talk to me!

title: Wolfstar: Discount
body:
Sirius: Moony, I like your clothes.
Remus: Thanks, it was 50% off.
Sirius, slyly: I’d like it 100% off.
Remus, knowing exactly what Sirius meant but wanting to act dumb anyway: Stores can’t give stuff for free, you dumbass.
Sirius: T-that’s not what I-
Remus, already planning to shag the man but wanting to make Sirius beg for it: Sirius, that’s a terrible way to run a business.

dialogue.name: Remus, knowing exactly what Sirius meant but wanting to act dumb anyway
dialogue.label: Remus, knowing exactly what Sirius meant but wanting to act dumb anyway:
dialogue.phrase: Stores can’t give stuff for free, you dumbass.
